text: وبرۢا بولديه ولم يكن جبارا عصيا

translations.translation: and devotion to his parents - he was not insolent or disobedient.
And kind to his parents, neither arrogant nor disobedient.
and cherishing to his parents. Never was he insolent or rebellious.
kind to his parents, not arrogant or a rebellious person.
And was good to his parents and not forceful, nor disobedient.
And dutiful to his parents, and he was not arrogant or disobedient.
And dutiful to his parents, and he was not insolent, disobedient.
and cherishing his parents, not arrogant, rebellious.
And dutiful toward his parents. And he was not arrogant, rebellious.
and dutiful towards his parents and was not haughty or disobedient.
And duteous unto his parents, and Was not high-handed rebel.
and good to his parents, and was not self-willed or disobedient.
And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
And dutiful towards his parents, and he was neither an arrogant nor disobedient (to Allah or to his parents).
honoring his parents, being neither arrogant nor rebellious.
And kind to his parents; and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.
[19:14] and dutiful to his parents, that is, virtuous towards them. And he was not arrogant or rebellious, disobedient to his Lord.
(And dutiful towards his parents) he was kind to his parent. (And he was not arrogant) in his practice of Religion, ready to hurt when angry, (rebellious) disobedient of his Lord.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَ } لنجابة طينته ألقينا في قلبه { بَرّاً } وإحساناً { بِوَالِدَيْهِ وَلَمْ يَكُن } في جميع أوقاته وحالاته { جَبَّاراً } عاقاً لهما مستكبراً عن أمرهما { عَصِيّاً } [مريم: 14] تاركاً حكمهما وأمرهما

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وبرًا بوالديه }: لطيفًا بهما محسنًا إليهما
 { ولم يكن جبارًا عصيًّا } متكبرًا عاقًا
 فالجبّار: هو المتكبر
 لأنه يجبر الناس على أخلاقه
 وقيل: من لا يقبل النصيحة
 أو عاصيًا الله تعالى
